weather_report:
Midnight settles over Katy with a soft, unbroken ceiling of cloud, the kind that muffles the edges of the neighborhood and turns porch lights into halos. There’s hardly a hint of moon or star; any sunshine you might have hoped for earlier stayed tucked away behind gray wool. UV is negligible now and was muted through the day, the sky more parchment than crystal, visibility serviceable but subdued.

Through the small hours and into the morning, expect the clouds to loiter, keeping things cool to mild and a bit somber rather than sparkly. It’s a long-sleeves sort of night, a light jacket by the door just in case, and comfortable shoes for quick errands when dawn sidles in. If you’re awake, this is good weather for quiet work at the kitchen table, tidying a corner you’ve been ignoring, or setting up tomorrow’s coffee so the morning greets you gently. Later, a short stroll between tasks will suit the mood—no glare to squint against, no harsh heat, only the calm of a sky that has decided to keep its secrets.
